page.title: 19The Village Pump
page.content: On the 13th May,1985, the Earl of Scarbrough unveiled the plaque to open the new village pump in Braithwell. It was donated by Mr. and Mrs. Appleyard, long standing residents of the village. Two stone troughs were gifts, one from the Earl of Scarbrough and the other from Mr.H.Garrison. The plaques were donated by Mr.T. Plowright and the curtains by M.A.Smythe. The Earl of Scarbrough drew the first water from the pump, wishing everyone peace and prosperity. Reverend Eccles then said a short prayer to bless the pump. Afterwards refreshments were served in the Red Lion public house and many villagers attended this special occasion. This event shows that community spirit is still alive in Braithwell.
